Stem: Upright, sometimes produce roots at lower joints.
Flowers: Compact in long cylindrical spike-like head. Surrounded by feathery bristles.
FruitSeeds: Yellow to brownish or straw-coloured with maturity. Retain surrounding bristles even after they have fallen.
Habitat: Roadsides, cropping land, grasslands, woodlands, waste areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Very similar to other *Cenchrus* species. May be distinguished by angular seed head and hairy bristles surrounding seeds.
